intro: Connarus congolanus, commonly known as the African sand thorn, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in regions with similar climates.
